Edward Stasheff
Lady and Gentlemen:
In lieu of a meeting, I'm writing a f<?w thoughts on the work
of the Publications Committee, for your reactions and your help.
Frankly, I’ve been unhappy about last couple Issues of the
Journal. They should have been better.
On the other hand, I think we have strengthened with the
Stasheff-Willls-Tincher series, which we’ll republloh as handbook in
June. I believe the Fact Sheets will add stature to the magazine.
There'll be eight in each of the next two issues.
We’ve been short on some good articles. And shcrt on pictures.
I think this is especially true as regards radio. I've cried, and
I’ve failed to secure help from a couple of areas. I’ll l<sep trying.

Now some thoughts about the future, for your reactions, tco0
The February Issue, at printer, will be on NAEB. I think it
will be useful, but I also have in mind, perhaps the first edition

broadcasting. Maybe it should induce closed-circuit TV, too?
My idea is to Include two or three maps, perhaps one showing ETV

How to increase Journal circulation 1b another problem.
I’m not unmindful of some problems with the NAEB NEWSLETTER,

change there shortly, so Immediate future poses a different type of
